result.execSummary:
The defendant David P. RADANDT was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • PTC Deliver Schedule I, II Narcotics (Fentanyl) [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(a).
  • PTC Deliver Schedule I, II Narcotics (Fentanyl) [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by the Department of Corrections.

Submit to random urine screens and pay for same.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department's assessment process.

Submit DNA sample.

Have no contact with Tyler Reed and Thomas Fagan
Pay restitution of $16,126.43, joint and several with Tyler Reed and Thomas Fagan.

timeConds.notes: under the Huber Law, to commence immediately on count 2 only.
On count 2 only, perform fifty (50) hours of community service work per year.

records.addlTxt:
The State files an Amended Information which charges one count PTC 1st degree reckless homicide and two counts PTC deliver Fentanyl.
NO CONTEST pleas entered to counts 2 and 3, two counts PTC deliver Fentanyl.  Convicted.
The State moves to dismiss and read in count 1.  Motion granted.
The Court orders a Presentence Investigation Report.
PSI is due on 09-25-15.
Sentencing is set for 10-01-15 at 8:30 a.m.
The Court orders the defendant to submit to a DNA sample at this time.

Information filed charging two counts; PTC 1st degree reckless homicide contrary to Sections 940.02(2)(a) and 939.05 and PTC delivery Fentanyl contrary to Sections 961.41(1)(a) and 939.05 of the Wisconsin Statutes.
NOT GUILTY pleas entered to both counts.  Jury calendar.

Joint preliminary hearing held with State vs. Thomas Fagan, Case No. 14 CF 278.  Probable cause found.  Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 3 for further proceedings.  Arraignment is set for 07-30-14 at 3:00 p.m.  
Minutes.

Defendant demands a preliminary hearing.  Defendant waives his statutory time limits within which a preliminary hearing must be held.  Preliminary hearing is set for 07-18-14 at 2:30 p.m.
Minutes.

Authorization to Appear.
Cover letter.
At 12:05 p.m. search warrant with return of officer thereon.
Affidavit of Erik Kowalski, Manitowoc City Police Department.
Search warrant issued.  RE:  Apple IPhone with number 920-323-9002 taken from the person of David Radandt for phone records from 05-01-14 through 06-23-14.
Re:  Christopher T. Vogel, on 05-08-14.

$5,000.00 cash bail furnished and defendant is released from custody.
Notice to Party Furnishing Cash Bond.

Defendant in custody.   
The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with PTC  1st Degree Reckless Homicide - Deliver Drugs.  The matter is continued for initial appearance on 06-30-14 at 2:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $5,000.00 cash with the conditions that defendant is to have no contact with Tyler Reed or Thomas Fagen and defendant must report to the Manitowoc City Police Department daily by 2:00 p.m.  Bail not furnished.  Defendant remanded to the county jail.  Commitment for failure to furnish bail issued.  Copy filed.   Probable Cause Statement and Judicial Determination.  
Minutes.
